attributes.comment:
Adoption is already a very expensive process. As prospective adoptive parents,
we are required to sumbit ourselves to numerous policies and procedures, which if
those seeking to be parents "the normal way" were to submit to, we would have
zero population growth. We have to prove we are decent, hard-working, law-
abiding, physically and mentally competent people. We also have to prove we can
afford to raise a child. That says nothing about we can afford the adoption
proceedure.

Raising the cost of filing orphan petitions, and other paperwork related to adoption
seems very unfair. The proposed increases will add hundreds more to the cost of
adoptiing a needy child from another country. These children need loving homes,
and in effect, they are the ones being penalized by the increased fees.

Please reconsider the increase in fees. Say "NO" to the proposed change.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
